// KINGBOLEN Ediag –ù–ï –∏–º–µ–µ—Ç –æ—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ SDK
// –ù–û –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–µ OBD-II –±–∏–±–ª–∏–æ—Ç–µ–∫–∏

// 1. –ß–µ—Ä–µ–∑ serialport (–µ—Å–ª–∏ –µ—Å—Ç—å COM-–ø–æ—Ä—Ç —ç–º—É–ª—è—Ü–∏—è)

// 2. –ß–µ—Ä–µ–∑ bluetooth-serial-port
const btSerial = require('bluetooth-serial-port');
const btDevice = new btSerial.BluetoothSerialPort();

// 3. –ß–µ—Ä–µ–∑ node-obd2 (–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Å ELM327-—Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–∏–º—ã–º–∏)

// –ü—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä –ø–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫ KINGBOLEN Ediag
async function connectToKingbolenEdiag() {
    try {
        // –ü–æ–∏—Å–∫ Bluetooth —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∞
        const devices = await btDevice.inquire();
        const ediagDevice = devices.find(d =>
            d.name.includes('EDIAG') ||
            d.name.includes('KINGBOLEN')
        );

        if (ediagDevice) {
            await btDevice.connect(ediagDevice.address, 1);
            console.log('–ü–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω –∫ KINGBOLEN Ediag:', ediagDevice.name);

            // –ò–Ω–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è ELM327 –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–æ–∫–æ–ª–∞
            await sendCommand('ATZ'); // Reset
            await sendCommand('ATE0'); // Echo off
            await sendCommand('ATL1'); // Line feeds on
            await sendCommand('ATS0'); // Spaces off
            await sendCommand('ATH1'); // Headers on
            await sendCommand('ATSP0'); // Auto protocol

            return true;
        }
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('–û—à–∏–±–∫–∞ –ø–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏—è:', error);
        return false;
    }
}

// –û—Ç–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∫–∞ AT –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥
async function sendCommand(command) {
    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
        btDevice.write(Buffer.from(command + '\r'), (err) => {
            if (err) reject(err);
            else resolve();
        });
    });
}

// –ß—Ç–µ–Ω–∏–µ OBD PID
async function readPID(pid) {
    const command = `01${pid}\r`;
    await btDevice.write(Buffer.from(command));

    return new Promise((resolve) => {
        btDevice.on('data', (data) => {
            const response = data.toString().trim();
            resolve(parseOBDResponse(response));
        });
    });
}

// –ü–∞—Ä—Å–∏–Ω–≥ –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç–∞ OBD
function parseOBDResponse(response) {
    // –£–¥–∞–ª—è–µ–º –∑–∞–≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–∫–∏ –∏ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–∏—Ä—É–µ–º
    const cleaned = response.replace(/\s/g, '').replace(/>/g, '');
    return cleaned;
}

# –ò–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è KINGBOLEN Ediag —Å python-obd

import obd
import bluetooth
import serial
import time

class KingbolenEdiagConnector:
    def __init__(self):
        self.connection = None
        self.bt_socket = None

    def find_ediag_device(self):
        """–ü–æ–∏—Å–∫ KINGBOLEN Ediag —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∞ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ Bluetooth"""
        devices = bluetooth.discover_devices(lookup_names=True)

        for addr, name in devices:
            if 'EDIAG' in name.upper() or 'KINGBOLEN' in name.upper():
                print(f"–ù–∞–π–¥–µ–Ω–æ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ: {name} ({addr})")
                return addr

        return None

    def connect_bluetooth(self, address):
        """–ü–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ Bluetooth"""
        try:
            self.bt_socket = bluetooth.BluetoothSocket(bluetooth.RFCOMM)
            self.bt_socket.connect((address, 1))  # –û–±—ã—á–Ω–æ –∫–∞–Ω–∞–ª 1
            print("Bluetooth –ø–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–æ")
            return True
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"–û—à–∏–±–∫–∞ Bluetooth –ø–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏—è: {e}")
            return False

    def connect_obd(self, port=None):
        """–ü–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ python-obd"""
        try:
            if port:
                self.connection = obd.OBD(port)
            else:
                # –ê–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫ –ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞
                self.connection = obd.OBD()

            if self.connection.status() == obd.OBDStatus.CAR_CONNECTED:
                print("OBD –ø–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ")
                return True
            else:
                print("–ù–µ —É–¥–∞–ª–æ—Å—å –ø–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –∫ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–æ–±–∏–ª—é")
                return False

        except Exception as e:
            print(f"–û—à–∏–±–∫–∞ OBD –ø–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏—è: {e}")
            return False

    def read_basic_data(self):
        """–ß—Ç–µ–Ω–∏–µ –±–∞–∑–æ–≤—ã—Ö –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö OBD-II"""
        if not self.connection:
            return None

        data = {}

        # –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã–µ PID
        commands = {
            'rpm': obd.commands.RPM,
            'speed': obd.commands.SPEED,
            'throttle_pos': obd.commands.THROTTLE_POS,
            'engine_load': obd.commands.ENGINE_LOAD,
            'coolant_temp': obd.commands.COOLANT_TEMP,
            'fuel_level': obd.commands.FUEL_LEVEL
        }

        for key, cmd in commands.items():
            response = self.connection.query(cmd)
            if response.value:
                data[key] = str(response.value)

        return data

    def read_dtc_codes(self):
        """–ß—Ç–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∫–æ–¥–æ–≤ –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫"""
        if not self.connection:
            return []

        response = self.connection.query(obd.commands.GET_DTC)
        if response.value:
            return [(code[0], code[1]) for code in response.value]

        return []

    def clear_dtc_codes(self):
        """–û—á–∏—Å—Ç–∫–∞ –∫–æ–¥–æ–≤ –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫"""
        if not self.connection:
            return False

        response = self.connection.query(obd.commands.CLEAR_DTC)
        return response.is_null() == False

Overview
This PR completes the implementation of core kiosk-agent components that were previously scaffolded but empty. Implements Prompts 3, 4, and 5 from the background agent prompts, providing essential functionality for OBD-II diagnostics analysis, device self-checks, HTTP API endpoints, and local/cloud storage.

Changes
AI/OBD Analysis Components (Prompt 3, Part 1)
src/ai/components/rules.ts

Implements diagnostic status aggregator for OBD-II scan results
Evaluates DTC codes, MIL status, freeze frames, and readiness monitors
Returns OK/WARNING/CRITICAL status with actionable recommendations
Includes Prometheus metrics for diagnostic operations
src/ai/components/dtc-insights.ts

DTC code analyzer with database of 20+ common diagnostic trouble codes
Provides Russian descriptions, possible causes, repair recommendations, and cost estimates
Fallback mechanism for unknown codes based on prefix (P/B/C/U)
Severity classification: LOW/MEDIUM/HIGH/CRITICAL
Self-Check Components (Prompt 3, Part 2)
src/selfcheck/components/obd-selfcheck.ts

5-step OBD-II adapter verification: connection ‚Üí initialization ‚Üí protocol ‚Üí VIN ‚Üí ECU
DEV/PROD mode support: skips checks gracefully in DEV, fails in PROD when unavailable
Detailed step timing and error reporting
Prometheus metrics for self-check operations and battery level
src/selfcheck/components/thickness-selfcheck.ts

5-step thickness gauge verification: BLE ‚Üí connection ‚Üí battery ‚Üí firmware ‚Üí calibration
Extracts device info (model, firmware version, battery level, serial number)
Same DEV/PROD mode handling as OBD checks
API Components (Prompt 4)
src/api/components/routes.ts

Complete HTTP API using Express.js (chosen for ecosystem maturity and stability)
12+ endpoints covering OBD operations, thickness measurements, payments, and locks
Request validation with Zod schemas
Centralized error handling and request logging
DEV-only endpoints properly protected (/api/payment/confirm-dev)
Prometheus HTTP metrics (request counts, durations)
Storage Components (Prompt 5)
src/storage/components/sqlite-store.ts

Local SQLite storage using better-sqlite3
Tables: sessions, selfcheck_logs, payment_receipts, config
Full CRUD operations with transaction support
Automatic table initialization and indexing
Cleanup methods for old data
src/storage/components/supabase-store.ts

Cloud storage integration with batching (10 logs or 5s interval)
Telemetry log aggregation with automatic flush
Report upload to storage buckets
Feature flags retrieval
Graceful error handling with retry logic
Prometheus metrics for cloud operations
Testing
Added 7 comprehensive test files with 84+ unit tests:

rules.test.ts - 9 tests for status aggregation scenarios
dtc-insights.test.ts - 19 tests for known/unknown DTC codes
obd-selfcheck.test.ts - 10 tests for DEV/PROD environments
thickness-selfcheck.test.ts - 15 tests for device checks

  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
);

ALTER PUBLICATION supabase_realtime ADD TABLE public.update_deployments;
ALTER PUBLICATION supabase_realtime ADD TABLE public.telemetry_logs;
